stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream brainstorming new overworld events and secret-star placements while previewing Badub’s overworld music pack.  He also vents about overhauling Mario 64’s audio engine and jokes about potential Nintendo legal action.

development_findings.summary: Current target is 180 stars (177 planned, 3 still missing) but Kaze is tempted to raise it to 200 if quality can be maintained.
development_findings.quote: "180 is the current plan, but 200 is kind of a nice number… we’ll see."

development_findings.summary: Overworld will contain about 50 000 polygons and stream-friendly music that cross-fades between 20+ overworld tracks.
Kaze is completely refactoring Mario 64’s sound engine and even plans to rewrite portions of the operating-system layer for performance and maintainability.
development_findings.quote: "I used to think the audio code in Mario 64 was the most competent part of the game, but… it was clearly written by five different guys that forgot what the others were writing."

development_findings.summary: 63 songs are already in-game; final soundtrack expected to reach ~120 tracks, using a mix of streamed and sequenced audio depending on size constraints.
New side-level concept: Bowser’s yacht becomes accessible once the Oily Boily Bay boss and Koopa Wave Cove step-3 are cleared, reached by riding a manta after the oil spill is removed.
Mini-boss inside the dojo: an elderly Yoshi sensei slowly attacks with a cane; one hit defeats him, unlocking a hint system for overworld secret stars.
Melon-farm event: spear-wielding shy guys try to steal giant melons; saving the farmer leads to a permanent potted Piranha Plant that ‘eats shy guys’.
Boshi post-duel character arc: he relocates to a remote ledge, practices shooting, then softens after 160 stars and gives the player a star after a target-practice dialogue.
Free-fall tower from Koopa Carnival will be modelled in the overworld for visual continuity.
Ambient SFX (rain, seagulls, jungle, ocean waves) supplied by Badub will be spatially placed in the overworld.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is frustrated by messy legacy code and by YouTube commenters predicting Nintendo takedowns.
context_findings.quote: "People will fucking kill me if I say anything negative about Nintendo."

context_findings.summary: He jokes about deliberately provoking a Nintendo lawsuit to crowdfund legal fees and ‘grift’ like Epic vs Apple.
Kaze sees video content and sponsorships as a ‘necessary evil’ to fund development and pay collaborators.
Workload ahead: finish overworld, refactor sound engine & OS, commission side levels, level reworks from Biobak, full beta test-and-fix pass.

biobak.summary: Continues large-scale level reworks; only Course 13’s detailed sub-area is still outstanding.
Suggests re-using baby-Yoshi head mechanic in future side courses.

badub.summary: Delivered an ‘RTYI Overworld Pack’ of ~20 seamless tracks plus extensive ambient sound effects for rain, seagulls, jungle, creatures, ocean waves.

zeina.summary: Greeted chat; currently adding heavy detail to a Course 13 area.
Helps moderate chat language (“no swearing hello Zeina”).

key_stories.title: Audio Engine Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Kaze discovered severe inefficiencies and redundant systems inside Mario 64’s original audio code and is rewriting it from scratch.
key_stories.challenge: Legacy engine performs unnecessary float multiplications and has triple-redundant volume caps.
key_stories.process: Spent a week reading and refactoring; N64 left running for 6.5 days to reproduce a time-based bug.
key_stories.outcome: Rewrite is in progress; performance and maintainability already improving.
key_stories.key_quote: It was clearly written by five different guys who forgot what the other three were writing.

key_stories.title: The Dojo Hint Master
key_stories.summary: A comedic boss fight introduces a scalable hint system for overworld secrets.
key_stories.challenge: Need an in-world way to guide players who miss hidden stars.
key_stories.process: Design an old Yoshi sensei who is defeated by a single hit; afterwards he offers sequential hints, first pointing to a secret door in the dojo itself.
key_stories.outcome: Adds both a boss character and a repeatable hint mechanic while keeping humour.
key_stories.key_quote: He will only share his knowledge with the skilled, so you have to beat him up first.

key_stories.title: Melon Farm Under Siege
key_stories.summary: Dynamic overworld event turns shy-guy raid into permanent environmental storytelling.
key_stories.challenge: Make the overworld feel ‘alive’ and provide another secret star.
key_stories.process: Shy guys corner a melon farmer; player rescues him.
key_stories.outcome: Yoshi plants a potted Piranha Plant that remains as evidence and protection, plus yields a star.
key_stories.key_quote: This plant has been trained to eat shy guys.
